alert.note: Alert for Rosebud (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 12:13AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Montana, including the following county, Rosebud. * WHEN...Until 315 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1211 AM MDT, Trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Radar estimates between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. In Forsyth an inch of rain fell in half an hour. - This includes portions of I-94 from near Forsyth to Hathaway. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Forsyth, Rosebud, Cartersville and Hathaway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
